gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that an aging population (Individual) will increase the burden on society (Environmental and Societal). No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as 'global healthcare costs' is an outcome, not an actor, and 'scientific understanding' is abstract.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science aims to champion the role of nutritional therapies that have proven clinical and health economic value, and improve the quality of people’s lives. The company focuses on three areas: Consumer Care, which aims to address specific health conditions with an emphasis on enhancing ‘healthy ageing’; Medical Nutrition, which supplies hospitals and other healthcare facilities; and Novel Therapeutic nutrition, which works on new nutritional therapies (including pre scribed medicines) for specific diseases and conditions that would be administered by a health professional.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Health Science as a single company with internal divisions; Individual: People whose lives are improved and health professionals who administer therapies; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Healthcare facilities and hospitals that receive supplies
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Inter-Organizational] Nestlé Health Science improves people's lives and supplies healthcare facilities through nutritional therapies.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows clear causal flows from Nestlé Health Science (organizational) to individuals through life improvement and to healthcare systems through supply relationships. The company's three divisions create distinct pathways of influence across scales.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Health Science and its internal units (Consumer Care, Medical Nutrition, Novel Therapeutic nutrition).; Individual: People/patients and health professionals explicitly mentioned.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The company and its units act to improve individuals’ health and enable administration by health professionals.
gpt5: Rationale: Cross-scale links are explicit: organizational actions target individuals’ outcomes and practices. Hospital supply is org-to-org (same scale) and thus excluded to keep valid cross-scale links.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Health Science is supported in its work by the Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences (NIHS) which under takes fundamental scientific research into how nutrition can be used to empower people to improve and maintain their health. NIHS research teams are providing greater insight into how our environment, diet and lifestyle intersect with our genetic make-up, gut microorganisms, metabolism and nutritional status to determine our health.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Health Science and NIHS are specific organizations conducting research; Individual: People who improve and maintain their health through nutrition

gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is environment affecting individual health. Organizational mentions (NIHS supporting Nestlé Health Science; teams providing insight) are same-scale or non-causal to individuals, so excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes research activities but does not explicitly state any cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.

Full Paragraph Text: NIHS has established the first complete essential nutrient profiling platform for accurate analysis of nutrient status. Thanks to the development of digital applications that capture dietary intake, the institute can now combine the information about the nutritional content of diet with measurements in people’s blood. This research offers the prospect of developing personalised nutrition products, including dietary recommendations.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: NIHS as an institute developing platforms and research capabilities; Individual: People providing blood measurements and receiving personalized nutrition products/recommendations

This represents clear cross-scale causality from organization to individual through data collection and product development.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé’s Jian Xin Double Care, a specially designed milk to enhance heart and bone health for middle-aged and senior adults, was launched in China in December 2013. The product contains phytosterols, which lower LDL (‘bad’) cholesterol, as well as calcium and vitamin D. The brand raises awareness of heart health with in-store health checks and offers toll-free phone contact with doctors to discuss cardiovascular health.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company and its dairy factory implementing zero water manufacturing; Environmental and Societal: The surrounding area community of 6400 people and water resource conservation
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Company factory water extraction benefits surrounding community water availability
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states the company's factory transformation saves water meeting consumption needs of 6400 people in the surrounding area, showing clear organizational action impacting societal water resources.

gpt5: Rationale: The organization’s factory change causes water savings explicitly measured against local people’s daily use, forming an org-to-individual impact. No inter-organizational or societal actors are explicitly involved.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The dairy factory is part of a company, making it an organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: The water savings impact the daily consumption of people in the surrounding area, a societal scale.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The factory's water-saving measures impact local water availability for 6400 people.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how the factory's actions (organizational) save water, affecting the local population's water consumption (societal). No other scales are involved.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how the Organizational actor (the company) through its water-saving actions causally influences the Individual actors (6400 people) by meeting their water consumption needs. Only two distinct scales were identified, fitting the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Mexico as one company and the specific factory in Jalisco; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Five other manufacturing sites around the world representing multi-organizational deployment
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational] Nestlé Mexico's water-saving technology scales to multiple global manufacturing sites
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that technology developed at one organizational unit (Nestlé Mexico factory) is being deployed across multiple manufacturing sites globally, representing clear organizational-to-inter-organizational scaling. Only two distinct scales are present in the causal chain described.

gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Mexico cut water withdrawal, directly reducing extraction from environmental water sources.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the organization reduced total water withdrawal, an action affecting environmental water systems. Factory-to-company effects are same-scale, and targeting water-stressed areas lacks explicit causal wording.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé Mexico's technology is being expanded to other sites, indicating a cross-scale influence from an organizational level to a sector level. No other scales are explicitly involved.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Water stressed areas influence Nestlé's organizational decisions to deploy water-saving technology.

This establishes a clear causal link where the environmental context influences organizational action. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: In March 2014, we opened the Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing, China. The new centre has three objectives: to collaborate with Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities in food safety research; to increase our ability to assess risks, anticipate problems and provide accurate information in any food safety situations; and to engage on scientific communication and food safety training.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé is deeply integrated into people’s lives with many buying our products on a daily basis. This gives us opportunities to contribute meaningfully to their quality of life. It is what our promise of Good Food, Good Life is all about: offering the best tasting, healthiest choices across a wide range of food and beverages, from morning to night and throughout life, helping people to live more enjoyable, healthy lives.

claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé influences people's daily lives through product integration and quality of life contributions
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly describes Nestlé (organizational) contributing meaningfully to people's quality of life through daily product purchases, establishing clear causal influence from company to individuals.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: People buying products are specific consumers.; Organizational: Nestlé is a single company.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumers’ purchases enable Nestlé’s efforts, and Nestlé’s healthier offerings help people live more enjoyable, healthy lives.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links consumer buying behavior to Nestlé’s opportunity to act, and Nestlé’s offerings to improved individual lives. No societal or environmental actor is stated, so only two scales are used.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's influence on individuals' lives but lacks explicit cross-scale causality. No direct causal link between different scales is stated.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people' and 'their lives' as specific consumers/households.; Organizational: Refers to 'Nestlé' as a single company/brand.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Nestlé's offerings help individuals live more enjoyable, healthy lives.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states Nestlé (Organizational) offers choices and helps people (Individual) to live more enjoyable, healthy lives, establishing a clear causal link. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: However, today, even brands that enjoy a high level of loyalty and trust need attention grabbing, engaging consumer communication to ensure they remain relevant to consumers. Therefore, excellence in brand building discipline and conviction about the importance of strong, sustainable brand equity is more important than ever, especially in an increasingly complex and crowded digital world.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses general principles about brand building and consumer communication without identifying specific actors or explicit causal relationships between different scales. It presents strategic observations rather than concrete cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “Brands” act by building and communicating.; Individual: “Consumers” are targeted recipients of communication.; Environmental and Societal: “An increasingly complex and crowded digital world” is a societal context.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] Brands communicate to keep consumer relevance; the crowded digital world heightens the need for brand-building excellence.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states brands must communicate to remain relevant to consumers (org action affecting individuals). It also ties the growing importance of brand-building to the complex digital world (environment shaping org needs). No inter-organizational actors are mentioned.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses the importance of brand communication and equity but does not explicitly describe a causal interaction between different scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Individual -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'consumers' as specific people.; Organizational: Refers to 'brands' as single entities/companies.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the 'digital world' as a societal-level system.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Brands interact with consumers through communication, while the digital world influences the importance of brand building for organizational relevance.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text describes how brands (Organizational) interact with consumers (Individual) and how the digital world (Environmental and Societal) influences organizational strategy. All three scales show explicit causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé as a company developing products and implementing nutritional criteria; Individual: Consumers purchasing products and families making breakfast choices; Environmental and Societal: Public health recommendations that inform nutritional standards
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Public health recommendations shape corporate nutritional standards, which influence family eating habits.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows a clear chain where societal health recommendations inform Nestlé's product criteria, and the company then communicates to influence family behaviors. Two distinct cross-scale causal links are explicitly described.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé/Maggi and its Nutritional Foundation criteria and consumer communication.; Environmental and Societal: Public health recommendations cited as the basis for criteria.; Individual: Families targeted by consumer communication.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Public health recommendations shape Nestlé criteria; Nestlé’s communication encourages families’ breakfast choices.
gpt5: Rationale: Public health recommendations (societal) explicitly inform Nestlé’s criteria (organizational). Nestlé’s consumer communication targets families (individuals). Other statements (e.g., strong sales) lacked explicit cross-scale causality.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Families and consumers are influenced by product communication.; Organizational: Nestlé as the organization producing Maggi Oats Noodles.; Environmental and Societal: Public health recommendations influencing Nestlé's criteria.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Public health recommendations influence Nestlé's product criteria, which in turn affect consumer choices.
4o: Rationale: The text shows public health recommendations affecting Nestlé's product criteria, and Nestlé's communication influencing consumer behavior. These are clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual | Individual -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Families/consumers are specific people.; Organizational: Nestlé is a single company.; Environmental and Societal: Public health recommendations represent societal-level systems/norms.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Public health recommendations influence Nestlé's product criteria, Nestlé's communication targets families, and strong sales from families benefit Nestlé.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The analysis identified three distinct scales: Individual (families), Organizational (Nestlé), and Environmental and Societal (public health recommendations). Links were established where explicit causality was stated, such as public health recommendations influencing Nestlé's criteria, Nestlé's communication targeting families, and individual sales benefiting Nestlé. No more than three scales were detected, adhering to the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Swiss Public Welfare Society (societal institution) and broader societal changes like factory work patterns; Organizational: The Maggi company as a specific business organization; Individual: Working population, women workers, and their dietary/food preparation needs
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Societal institution requests company to address working population's dietary needs
claude4: Rationale: The Swiss Public Welfare Society directly commissioned Maggi to develop products, showing clear societal-to-organizational causality. Societal changes in work patterns also directly affected individual food preparation behaviors. Both links represent explicit causal relationships described in the text.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Julius Maggi; working women/population; Organizational: Maggi company; Swiss Public Welfare Society; Environmental and Societal: Advent of factory work for women
gpt5: Summary: [Individual|Organizational|Environmental and Societal] A welfare society’s request spurred Julius Maggi; factory work reduced women’s cooking time; Maggi’s soups offered a convenient alternative.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit cross-scale causality links an organization’s request to an individual’s action, and societal labor shifts to individuals’ time scarcity; company sales then affected individuals’ options. Kept to three clear scales.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Women working in factories.; Organizational: Maggi company.; Environmental and Societal: Swiss Public Welfare Society.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] The Swiss Public Welfare Society influenced Maggi to produce soups, which then benefited working women.
4o: Rationale: The Swiss Public Welfare Society's request led Maggi to produce soups, impacting working women by providing a convenient food option. These interactions span three scales: societal, organizational, and individual.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Individual | Individual -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Julius Maggi, working population, and women are specific people or informal groups.; Organizational: Maggi company is a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: Swiss Public Welfare Society and factory work represent societal-level systems or organizations addressing societal issues.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The Swiss Public Welfare Society requested Julius Maggi to create soups, which the Maggi company sold to individuals affected by factory work.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how societal factors (Swiss Public Welfare Society, factory work) influenced individuals (Julius Maggi, women), who in turn influenced or were influenced by an organization (Maggi company). Three distinct scales were identified: Individual, Organizational, and Environmental and Societal, all explicitly linked by causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Maggi entered the Nestlé family in 1947, when the holding company, Alimen tana S.A., merged with Nestlé to become Nestlé Alimentana S.A.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a merger between two organizational entities (Maggi/Alimentana S.A. and Nestlé) but this represents a same-scale interaction between organizations, not a cross-scale hierarchical interaction. No causal influence across different scales is described.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All actions are between organizations (Maggi, Nestlé, Alimentana S.A.) and describe a merger. No actor at a different scale (individual, societal, inter-org system) causally influences another scale.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a merger between two organizations, but does not explicitly describe any cross-scale causality involving different scales such as individual or societal levels.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: All actors identified (Maggi, Nestlé, Alimentana S.A., Nestlé Alimentana S.A.) are classified as 'Organizational' scale entities. The described interactions (entering a family, merging) are therefore intra-scale, not cross-scale, and do not meet the criteria for hierarchical interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: Last year, Maggi created a new breakfast option for the Indian market, Maggi Oats Noodles, offering Nutrition, Health and Wellness in a bowl. The noodles are made from 51% wholegrain oat flour, fibre (equivalent to one bowl of oats), with a real vegetable garnish, as well as the popular authentic masala taste.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Maggi's product development and features but contains no explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales. It only presents factual information about a single organization's product without describing cross-scale influences or effects.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Maggi (a brand/company) acts by creating a product.; Environmental and Societal: The 'Indian market' is a societal-level market system.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Maggi launched a product for the Indian market, showing org action aimed at a societal market.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is Maggi targeting the Indian market. The text does not explicitly mention individuals or inter-organizational actors, so those scales were excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a product launch by Maggi but does not explicitly show cross-scale causality between different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a product launch by an organizational actor (Maggi) for a specific market (Indian market). However, it does not explicitly state any causal influence or interaction between these different scales, only that the product was 'created for' the market, which does not meet the strict requirement for a hierarchical cross-scale link.

Full Paragraph Text: Parents want their children to make the most of their potential. Nestlé Milo, which is mainly consumed by children aged 7–12, can help to provide the nourishing energy they need to succeed. Activ-Go plays a role in energy release, muscle function, bone maintenance and red blood cell formation, all essential for physical activity.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes parents wanting children to succeed and Nestlé Milo providing nutrition, but lacks explicit causal connections between different organizational scales. Parents and children are Individual scale, Nestlé is Organizational scale, but no cross-scale influence is explicitly stated - only product benefits are described.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Milo/Activ-Go are branded product/formulation of a company.; Individual: Children aged 7–12 as consumers with energy and activity outcomes.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Nestlé Milo (with Activ-Go) provides energy that supports children’s physical activity and success.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the product/formulation aids children’s energy and activity, a direct org-to-individual causal effect. No societal or inter-organizational actors are described.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Children aged 7–12 are specific people.; Organizational: Nestlé Milo is a brand, part of an organization.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Nestlé Milo influences children by providing energy for their physical activities.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé Milo, an organizational actor, provides energy to children, an individual actor, thus creating a cross-scale interaction. No other scales are involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Parents and children are specific people.; Organizational: Nestlé Milo is a product/brand of a company.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Nestlé Milo provides nourishing energy to children.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Nestlé Milo (Organizational) helps provide nourishing energy to children (Individual). No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as parental desires were not shown to causally influence the organization in this text.

Full Paragraph Text: The re-launched recipe with Activ-Go was developed by our scientists and intro duced in 2014 in Indonesia, Malaysia and Vietnam. It will be launched in other Asian, African and Latin American countries this year.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes product development and launch activities but lacks explicit causal relationships between different organizational scales. Scientists developing a recipe and geographic market launches are operational activities without clear cross-scale influence.
gpt5: Links: Individual -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: “Our scientists” are workers performing development.; Organizational: The company/brand that owns and introduces the product.; Environmental and Societal: Countries (Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam; other regions) are societal contexts.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual | Organizational | Environmental and Societal] Scientists built the recipe, and the company launched it across specific countries and plans more.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states individuals (scientists) developed the product for the company, and the company introduced/launched it in countries. Only these three scales appear clearly and are cross-linked.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions by an organization (scientists developing a recipe) but does not explicitly show cross-scale causality with other scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Individual -> Organizational | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'our scientists' who are specific people.; Organizational: Refers to the implicit company that 're-launched' and 'introduced' the recipe, and employs the scientists.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'Indonesia, Malaysia and Vietnam' and 'other Asian, African and Latin American countries' as national markets/societies.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Scientists developed a recipe that an organization launched into national markets.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes scientists (Individual) developing a product for an organization (Organizational), which then introduces this product into national markets (Environmental and Societal). This establishes two distinct cross-scale causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. He created Nestlé Milo from malt, milk and cocoa to give children the nutritious energy they need to get the best out of their day. It was launched at the Sydney Easter Show in 1934.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical product development and launch events but contains no explicit causal interactions between different scales. Thomas Mayne's creation of Milo and its launch are organizational activities without cross-scale causality described.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Thomas Mayne and the children are specific people/groups.; Organizational: Nestlé Milo is a brand/product entity within Nestlé.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] An engineer created the Milo brand, which provides nutritious energy to children.
gpt5: Rationale: Individuals (Mayne, children) and the brand (Nestlé Milo) are explicit actors. The text states Mayne created the brand and that the brand gives energy to children. No broader societal or inter-org actors are specified.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Thomas Mayne, a specific person, is involved.; Organizational: Nestlé, a company, is involved.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Thomas Mayne, an individual, created Nestlé Milo for the organization Nestlé to address children's nutritional needs.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Thomas Mayne's role in creating a product for Nestlé, showing a clear cross-scale interaction. Only two scales are involved, so no limitation on scale number.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Thomas Mayne (specific person) and children (specific group of people).; Organizational: Nestlé (a single company).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] An individual engineer's creation directly influenced an organization's product portfolio.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Thomas Mayne, an individual, created Nestlé Milo. This act of creation by an individual directly resulted in a product for Nestlé, an organization, thus establishing a causal link from the Individual to the Organizational scale. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as the interaction between the engineer and children is same-scale, and Nestlé's influence on Mayne's creation is not explicitly stated beyond affiliation.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo has been a staunch supporter of youth sports throughout its history, and has fuelled generations through their formative years.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Milo's historical support of youth sports and role in fueling generations, but contains no explicit causal interactions between different scales. It presents general statements about support and impact without specifying concrete actors or mechanisms of influence across hierarchical levels.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Milo is a brand/organization.; Environmental and Societal: Youth sports refers to a community-level societal system.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé Milo supports youth sports, indicating org-level influence on a community system.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit wording shows the organization supports a societal-level system (youth sports). The phrase about “fuelled generations” is too vague to map to concrete individuals, so no Individual scale link is included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Milo's support for youth sports but does not explicitly show a causal interaction between different scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Milo is a brand/company.; Environmental and Societal: Youth sports represents a societal-level system/community activity.; Individual: Generations refer to groups of people/individuals.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal, Individual] Nestlé Milo supports youth sports and fuels generations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé Milo (Organizational) supporting youth sports (Environmental and Societal) and directly fueling generations (Individual). Two distinct cross-scale causal links are identified, both originating from the Organizational scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 Nestlé’s organic growth was 4.5%, composed of 2.3% real internal growth and 2.2% pricing. Sales were CHF 91.6 billion, down 0.6%, impacted by negative foreign exchange of –5.5%. Acquisitions, net of divestitures, added 0.4% to sales.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph presents only financial metrics and performance data for Nestlé as a single organizational entity. No cross-scale causal interactions are described - only internal growth rates, pricing changes, and financial impacts are reported without any explicit influence relationships between different hierarchical scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé's sales and growth metrics are at the company level.; Environmental and Societal: Foreign exchange rates are part of broader economic systems.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Negative foreign exchange rates reduced Nestlé’s sales.
gpt5: Rationale: Nestlé (organizational) is explicitly affected by foreign exchange (environmental/societal). Other figures (pricing, internal growth, acquisitions) are internal and do not form cross-scale links.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes financial metrics and changes but does not explicitly show cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé is a company.; Environmental and Societal: Foreign exchange represents capital markets/economic systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Foreign exchange negatively impacted Nestlé's sales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that foreign exchange (Environmental and Societal) impacted Nestlé’s sales (Organizational). Acquisitions and divestitures were internal organizational actions affecting sales, not cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. The cost of goods sold fell by 30 basis points as a percentage of sales, driven by product mix and pricing actions and savings created by Nestlé Continuous Excellence which more than offset increases in raw material costs. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph presents only financial metrics and operational results for one organization (Nestlé Group). While it mentions various business activities like pricing actions and marketing support, these are all internal organizational activities without explicit causal relationships to actors at different scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Commodity/raw material markets with rising input prices.; Organizational: Nestlé Group and its internal costs/metrics (e.g., COGS).
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal | Organizational] External raw material cost increases influenced Nestlé’s COGS, offset by internal savings.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly notes increases in raw material costs and that internal savings offset them, linking market conditions to company costs. Other changes (pricing, product mix, marketing spend) are internal-only.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé's internal actions and financial metrics.; Environmental and Societal: Raw material costs influenced by broader market conditions.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Raw material costs influenced Nestlé's cost of goods sold.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal-level raw material costs affected Nestlé's organizational-level cost of goods sold. No other scales were clearly defined.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'The Group' (Nestlé), 'Nestlé Continuous Excellence', and 'our brands'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'raw material costs' as a market/economic factor.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Raw material costs influenced the Group's cost of goods sold, which was then mitigated by organizational savings.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states 'increases in raw material costs' (Environmental and Societal) influenced 'The Group's' (Organizational) cost of goods sold, which was then offset. This establishes a clear causal link from Environmental and Societal to Organizational. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as 'consumer facing' marketing lacked an explicit effect on individuals.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s operating cash flow remained strong at CHF 14.7 billion.
claude4: Rationale: The sentence only reports a financial metric (operating cash flow) for 'The Group' without describing any causal interactions between different scales. It's a standalone financial statement with no cross-scale causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only one organizational actor (“The Group”) is mentioned with a financial metric; no cross-scale causal influence is described.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph only provides a financial figure for the Group's cash flow without indicating any cross-scale causal interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a financial metric for a single entity ('The Group' - Organizational scale) but does not describe any causal interaction between this entity and an actor at a different scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we delivered strong results in a soft trading environment, building on the good growth of past years. They demonstrate the intrinsic strengths of Nestlé: the commit ment of our people, our global footprint, the strength of our portfolio and the quality of our innovation. While delivering in the short term, we remain focused on our business long term, strengthening the foundations of future growth.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's performance and attributes but lacks explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions 'our people' (Individual) and Nestlé as an organization (Organizational), there are no clear statements showing how one scale causally influences another - only general descriptions of company strengths and performance.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: “our people” (employees) are explicitly cited.; Organizational: Nestlé as the firm delivering results and possessing strengths.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Employees’ commitment is presented as a core strength of Nestlé, linking individual behavior to organizational capability.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links employee commitment (individual) to Nestlé’s strengths (organizational), an explicit cross-scale attribution. The “soft trading environment” is context, not a stated cause, so no environmental link.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's performance and strategy but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions. It focuses on internal strengths and strategic focus without linking different scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'our people' within Nestlé.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' and 'Nestlé' as a single company.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the 'soft trading environment'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Individual commitment and the trading environment influenced Nestlé's organizational performance.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how the 'soft trading environment' (Environmental and Societal) provided a challenging context for 'Nestlé' (Organizational) to deliver results. Additionally, the 'commitment of our people' (Individual) is identified as a core strength contributing to 'Nestlé's' (Organizational) performance. Three distinct scales were identified, adhering to the limit.

Full Paragraph Text: The Zone’s organic growth was supported by double-digit growth for Nescafé Dolce Gusto and strong performances in ambient dairy and petcare. In North America growth improved towards the end of the year while in Latin America good growth was helped by pricing, reflecting inflationary pressures.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance metrics and market conditions but lacks explicit causal relationships between actors at different scales. Growth patterns, pricing strategies, and inflationary pressures are mentioned as correlations or contextual factors without clear cross-scale causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Inflationary pressures are macroeconomic conditions.; Organizational: Pricing and regional growth are actions/results of the company or its units.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Inflationary pressures drove company pricing, which aided Latin America growth.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties pricing to inflationary pressures, establishing a macro-to-organization causal link. Other mentions (brand/category performances supporting a Zone) are intra-organizational, so excluded. Only two clear scales were needed.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes growth and performance metrics but does not explicitly state any cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'pricing' as an action taken by a company/business unit ('The Zone' and 'Nescafé Dolce Gusto' are also organizational entities).; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'inflationary pressures' as a societal/economic factor.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Inflationary pressures influenced organizational pricing decisions in Latin America.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links 'inflationary pressures' (Environmental and Societal) to 'pricing' (Organizational action). Other interactions, such as 'The Zone's growth supported by Nescafé Dolce Gusto', are intra-organizational and thus not cross-scale. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Specific brands (Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets, California Pizza Kitchen, etc.) and business units repositioning products; Individual: Consumers whose relevance and preferences drive brand repositioning efforts
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumer trends drive brand repositioning across multiple product categories
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states brands are being repositioned to enhance relevance to consumers by reflecting their trends. This shows clear causality from consumer preferences to organizational brand strategy changes.
gpt5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Links: Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company and its brands (Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets, Stouffers) undertaking projects and reporting performance.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The 'frozen category' as a market segment influencing firms.; Environmental and Societal: Societal trends such as 'organic' and 'ethnic'.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Sector category affected company performance, and societal trends drove how the firm designed its marketing projects.
gpt5: Rationale: Two explicit cross-scale causal statements are present: the frozen category impacted company performance, and societal trends guided project design. We limited to three scales, excluding Individuals despite mention of consumers.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers are influenced by brand repositioning and product innovations.; Organizational: Brands like Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets, and Stouffers are organizations making strategic changes.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Brands repositioning and innovations aim to enhance consumer relevance and drive growth.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how organizational actions (brand repositioning and product innovations) are intended to influence individual consumers. The focus is on enhancing brand relevance and driving consumer growth, which is a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'consumers'.; Organizational: Refers to 'Projects', 'brands' (Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets, Stouffers), and the implied company 'We'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'trends such as organic and ethnic'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Organizational projects are influenced by societal trends and aim to enhance brand relevance for individual consumers.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how 'projects' (Organizational) are 'reflecting trends' (Environmental and Societal), establishing a causal link from E&S to Org. Furthermore, these 'projects' are 'enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers' (Individual), showing a causal link from Org to Individual. All three identified scales are distinct and directly involved in cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Macroeconomic situation, consumer sentiment across region, fiscal legislation changes, market conditions; Organizational: Specific brands (Ninho, KitKat, Nesfit, Nescau, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, Dog Chow, Pro Plan) and their performance; Individual: Consumer demand and purchasing behavior
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Macroeconomic conditions and fiscal changes affected brand performance and consumer demand across Latin America
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly describes how macroeconomic deterioration and fiscal legislation changes causally affected both organizational brand performance and individual consumer behavior. Two clear cross-scale causal relationships are evident from the explicit wording.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers in Mexico ('subdued consumer demand').; Environmental and Societal: The market in Mexico ('affected the market').
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Environmental and Societal] Subdued consumer demand affected the market in Mexico.
gpt5: Rationale: The only explicit cross-scale causality is consumer demand impacting the market. Other factors (fiscal legislation, pricing) either act within the same scale or lack a clear actor, so they were excluded.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers in Latin America with varying sentiment.; Organizational: Brands like Ninho, KitKat, Nesfit, Nescau, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, Dog Chow, and Pro Plan.; Environmental and Societal: Macroeconomic situation and fiscal legislation in Mexico.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Fiscal changes in Mexico impacted organizations, while macroeconomic factors influenced consumer sentiment.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how fiscal legislation (Environmental and Societal) affected market performance (Organizational) and how macroeconomic conditions influenced consumer sentiment (Individual). These are explicit cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to specific brands (Ninho, KitKat, Nescafé Dolce Gusto) and the aggregate performance of companies in Latin America.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to markets, Brazil's categories, and the petcare business, representing systems among organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the macroeconomic situation and fiscal legislation, representing societal-level systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] External societal factors and organizational brand contributions influenced market and company performance in Latin America.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly links Environmental and Societal factors, Organizational entities, and Inter-Organizational / Sector markets. The Individual scale (consumer sentiment/demand) was present but excluded to meet the 3-scale limit, focusing on the most central business interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Relative to the market this was good growth, driven by innovation and premiumisation. The European trading en vironment continued to be volatile and intense, with defla tionary pressure increasing during the year and consumer confidence very fragile, reducing the flexibility to price.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Company experiencing growth driven by innovation and premiumisation strategies; Environmental and Societal: European trading environment, deflationary pressure, consumer confidence as market-level conditions
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Market conditions constrained company pricing flexibility
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that European trading environment volatility and consumer confidence fragility reduced the company's pricing flexibility. This demonstrates clear causality from societal-level market conditions to organizational strategy constraints.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: European trading environment, deflationary pressure, consumer confidence are macro conditions.; Organizational: The firm whose growth and pricing flexibility are described.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Macroeconomic volatility and fragile consumer confidence reduced the firm's pricing flexibility.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states macro conditions reduced pricing flexibility, a cross-scale effect on the firm. Innovation-driven growth is intra-organizational and not cross-scale, so excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes market conditions and consumer confidence but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'consumer confidence', which is a characteristic of individual consumers.; Organizational: Implied actor whose 'flexibility to price' is reduced, typically a company or brand.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'deflationary pressure' and the 'European trading environment', which are societal/economic systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Fragile consumer confidence and increasing deflationary pressure reduced organizations' pricing flexibility.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links two distinct societal-level factors – deflationary pressure (Environmental and Societal) and consumer confidence (Individual) – to the operational capabilities of an organization (Organizational). Both factors are stated as causally 'reducing the flexibility to price' for an implied organizational actor. Three distinct scales were identified and used.

Full Paragraph Text: Good performances in France, Switzerland, Austria and the Netherlands, and a recovery in Spain and Portugal sup ported the growth in Western Europe. The Great Britain region, Germany, Italy and Greece were more challenged. There were strong performances from petcare and Nescafé Dolce Gusto across Western Europe and we saw good growth from innovations in several categories. Highlights included Nescafé Gold and Azzera premium soluble coffee, Fresh Up and Buitoni Fiesta in frozen pizza, Maggi snacking noodles in ambient culinary and the launch of premium chocolate tablets Les Recettes de l’Atelier in France.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business performance across countries and product categories but lacks explicit causal relationships between different hierarchical scales. All content relates to organizational-level performance without clear cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All effects described are within the same scale (e.g., country to region, organizational innovations to organizational growth). No explicit causal link across two different scales is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes performances and product launches without explicit cross-scale causal interactions. No hierarchical links between defined scales are evident.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes performance outcomes and their relationships (e.g., 'performances supported growth') rather than explicit actors at one scale causally influencing actors at another scale. No concrete actors performing actions across scales are identified as per the strict protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: In Central and Eastern Europe, Russia and Ukraine drove the growth in a deteriorating economic environment. Pet care, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, soluble coffee, particularly Gold Blend, and confectionery with KitKat were the highlights. The ongoing roll-out of Papyrus cooking papers in ambient culinary also continued to do well.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes product performance and market conditions but lacks explicit causal relationships between different organizational scales. It mentions countries, brands, and products but doesn't establish how actors at one scale directly influence actors at another scale.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Countries and regional economic environment (Russia, Ukraine, Central and Eastern Europe).; Organizational: Brands/product lines (Pet care, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, Gold Blend, KitKat, Papyrus) within a company.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Russia and Ukraine markets drove company growth; specific brands performed well.
gpt5: Rationale: Countries (societal scale) are explicitly said to drive growth of the firm/brands (organizational scale). Other statements only describe product performance within the organization, with no cross-scale causality. Kept to 2 scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes economic growth and product highlights but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Russia and Ukraine are countries/governments; 'economic environment' is a societal-level system.; Organizational: Product categories and brands (e.g., Pet care, Nescafé Dolce Gusto, KitKat) represent organizational outputs/performance.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Russia and Ukraine, as national markets, drove the growth of specific organizational product categories and brands, demonstrating a direct cross-scale influence.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Russia and Ukraine (Environmental and Societal scale) 'drove the growth' of various product categories and brands (Organizational scale). No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, nor were other scales present in a causally linked manner.

Full Paragraph Text: Petcare delivered broad-based growth across the Zone, further strengthening its positions, in particular through the premium category with Felix, Purina ONE and Gourmet, and our snacks range.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Petcare's performance and brand positioning but contains no explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales. It only reports organizational outcomes without describing cross-scale mechanisms or influences.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only organizational actors (Petcare, brands) are mentioned; no explicit causal influence across different scales is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes growth and product categories but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions and outcomes solely within the 'Organizational' scale (Petcare, its brands, and products). No explicit causal interactions between actors at different defined scales are present.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.
claude4: Links: Individual -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Chinese consumers with fast-changing expectations; Organizational: The company adapting portfolio and focusing on innovation; Environmental and Societal: China as a market system and Oceania as a regional market
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Consumer expectations drive company portfolio adaptation
claude4: Rationale: Chinese consumers' changing expectations explicitly caused organizational adaptation through portfolio changes and innovation focus. China as a market system also influenced organizational performance, creating slower growth that required strategic response.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Chinese consumers as specific people whose expectations are cited.; Organizational: "We"/the Zone as the company organizational unit making decisions.; Inter-Organizational: Trade channels/stock management as channel systems among firms.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Inter-Organizational] Chinese consumer expectations drove portfolio changes; the company acted to develop new trade channels in Oceania.
gpt5: Rationale: Consumers explicitly cause the firm to adapt its portfolio. The firm explicitly acts to shape trade channels. To keep ≤3 scales, broader markets (China/Oceania as societal) were omitted despite being mentioned.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Chinese consumers are individuals whose expectations influence the organization.; Organizational: The organization is adapting its portfolio and strategies.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Chinese consumer expectations led the organization to adapt its portfolio.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how the organization adapted its portfolio due to the expectations of Chinese consumers, establishing a clear cross-scale interaction. No other scales were explicitly involved.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'Chinese consumer' as specific people.; Organizational: Refers to 'the Zone' and 'we' (the company) as a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'China' and 'Oceania' as market regions representing societal-level systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Slower growth was due to market conditions, leading the company to adapt its portfolio based on evolving consumer expectations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The analysis identified two hierarchical links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational, where market conditions impacted company growth, and Individual -> Organizational, where consumer expectations drove company adaptation. Three distinct scales were identified, adhering to the protocol's limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Strong growth continued in most other emerging markets, in particular the Philippines, South Asia, the Indochina region, Turkey and many markets in Africa. We introduced new premium noodles in Singapore and Malaysia. In the Philippines the new fortified Bear Brand milk powders were well received. Maggi created a new breakfast option for the Indian market, Maggi Oats Noodles, and Nestlé Milo Activ-Go was launched in parts of South East Asia. It was also rolled out in Africa, helping to deliver good growth across the continent.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational activities (product launches, market performance) but lacks explicit causal relationships between different scales. All actions are at the organizational level without clear cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé/Maggi acted (created/launched products).; Environmental and Societal: National/regional markets (India, Singapore, Malaysia, Africa) are societal-level contexts.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational -> Environmental and Societal] Maggi created a new breakfast option for the Indian market, affecting market offerings.
gpt5: Rationale: Multiple sentences show the firm introducing products into national/regional markets, a clear org-to-market influence. I avoid duplicates of the same scale pair and exclude Individuals since consumers aren’t explicitly named.
4o: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Consumers in specific regions like the Philippines and India.; Organizational: Companies like Nestlé and its brands (Maggi, Milo).; Environmental and Societal: Markets in regions like South East Asia and Africa.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] Nestlé's product launches influenced consumer choices and contributed to market growth in specific regions.
4o: Rationale: The text describes how Nestlé's actions (Organizational) affected consumer behavior (Individual) and regional market growth (Environmental and Societal). These are clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Implied customers/households who 'well received' the product.; Organizational: Companies/brands like Nestlé, Maggi, and Bear Brand.; Environmental and Societal: Geographical markets/regions (e.g., Singapore, Africa) representing societal-level systems where products are introduced and received.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Organizational actors introduce products into societal markets, which are then received by individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly describes Organizational actors (Nestlé, Maggi, Bear Brand) introducing products into various Environmental and Societal markets (e.g., Singapore, Africa). One instance also implies that an Organizational product was 'well received' by Individual customers. All identified scales are within the limit of three.

Full Paragraph Text: Strong innovation in products and business models drove performance in Japan with the coffee systems Nescafé Dolce Gusto and Nescafé Gold Blend Barista doing well and KitKat maintaining its growth momentum.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes product performance and innovation outcomes but lacks explicit causal relationships between different organizational scales. All mentioned elements (products, business models, performance) operate at the same organizational level without clear cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All actions and effects concern brands/organizational performance; 'Japan' is a location, not an acting societal system. No explicit causal influence across different scales is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes product performance but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions. It mentions innovation and product success without linking different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes innovation in products and business models driving performance for specific brands (Nescafé, KitKat). All identified elements—innovation, brands, and their performance—pertain to the Organizational scale. No explicit causal links between different defined scales are present.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Waters delivered solid broad-based organic and real internal growth in all three geographies. Nestlé Pure Life continued to be a growth engine, particularly in the emerging markets but also in North America and the United Kingdom. Perrier and S.Pellegrino, our premium international brands, continued to demonstrate our ability to create value in the category. Complementing these performances, strong local brands also delivered good growth, especially Buxton in the United Kingdom, Erikli in Turkey, La Vie in Vietnam and Yunnan Shan Quan in China.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph only describes organizational-level performance metrics for Nestlé Waters and its brands across different markets. No explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales are described - only business performance outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The text reports brand and company growth across regions but does not state that societal/regional factors caused it or that the brands altered societal systems. No explicit cross-scale causality is given.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes growth and performance of brands but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Nestlé Waters and all mentioned brands (Nestlé Pure Life, Perrier, S.Pellegrino, Buxton, Erikli, La Vie, Yunnan Shan Quan) are specific companies or brands, mapping to the Organizational scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph exclusively describes the performance and growth of various brands and the parent company, all of which fall under the 'Organizational' scale. No explicit causal links between actors at different defined scales are present. Geographical regions are mentioned as locations of growth, not as active causal agents.

Full Paragraph Text: The Annual Report, and its accompanying reports are available online as a PDF in English, French and German. The consolidated income statement, balance sheet and cash flow statement are also available as Excel files.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph only describes document availability and formats without identifying any actors or causal relationships between different scales. It is purely informational about report accessibility.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes the availability of reports and statements in different formats and languages, but does not describe any cross-scale causal interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
