Full Paragraph Text: This is a PDF version of the Unilever Annual Report and Accounts 2014 and is an exact copy of the printed document provided to Unilever’s shareholders.
claude4: Rationale: This text is merely a descriptive statement about document format and distribution. It contains no actors performing actions that would create cross-scale interactions, only metadata about a report's nature and delivery method.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a single company acting.; Individual: Shareholders are specific people receiving the document.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever provided a printed report to its shareholders.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states Unilever (org) provided a document to shareholders (individuals), a direct cross-scale action. No other scales or inter-organizational dynamics are mentioned.
4o: Rationale: The text describes a document format and distribution, not interactions between different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company.; Individual: Shareholders are specific people.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever provides its annual report to shareholders, demonstrating a direct interaction.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that Unilever (Organizational) provides a document to its shareholders (Individual). This constitutes a direct causal influence from the organizational level to the individual level, as information is transferred. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 Unilever launched a newly developed packaging technology for Dove Body Wash bottles that uses 15% less plastic. Projected cost savings for the whole portfolio are €50 million. This is another substantial step towards the USLP target of halving Unilever’s waste footprint by 2020.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a single company launching technology and achieving cost savings; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The whole portfolio spanning multiple product lines and market systems
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational] Unilever's packaging innovation drives portfolio-wide cost savings of €50 million
claude4: Rationale: Unilever as a single organization explicitly causes financial impact across its broader portfolio system. The technology launch at organizational level directly generates measurable cross-portfolio effects, representing clear upward causality from company to sector-level outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All actions and effects are internal to Unilever (an organization). No explicit causal influence to or from inter-organizational or societal/environmental actors is stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company implementing the packaging technology.; Environmental and Societal: The waste footprint target relates to societal-level environmental impact.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's packaging innovation aims to reduce its environmental waste footprint, impacting societal environmental goals.
4o: Rationale: Unilever's action (Organizational) directly targets reducing its waste footprint, a societal-level environmental goal (Environmental and Societal). No other scales are involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph focuses solely on Unilever's internal actions (launching technology, achieving targets) and their direct consequences (cost savings, waste footprint reduction) within the Organizational scale. No explicit actors or causal interactions involving other scales (Individual, Inter-Organizational/Sector, Environmental and Societal) are described.

Full Paragraph Text: The MuCell® Technology for Extrusion Blow Moulding was created in partnership with two packaging suppliers – ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion. By using gas-injection to create gas bubbles in the middle layer of the bottle wall, it reduces the density of the bottle and the amount of plastic required.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a technology development partnership between organizations (ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion) and explains how the technology works, but contains no explicit cross-scale causal interactions. All actors operate at the organizational level with no influence described between different hierarchical scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The text mentions organizations and a partnership but only describes a technology affecting material properties. No explicit causal influence across two defined scales is stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion are specific organizations.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The partnership between ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion represents a collaboration among organizations.
4o: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] The partnership between ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion led to the creation of a new technology impacting the organizations.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a partnership (Inter-Organizational) that resulted in a technological development affecting the organizations involved. No other scales are explicitly mentioned.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a partnership between two packaging suppliers (ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion), both classified as 'Organizational' scale actors. This interaction is within the same scale, not across different hierarchical scales. The technology's effects are on the product itself, not explicitly on an actor at a different scale.

Full Paragraph Text: The technology represents a breakthrough for Unilever and the industry. With up to 59 million Dove Body Wash bottles sold across Europe, the new technology will save approximately 180 tonnes of plastic a year overall. A full roll-out across every Unilever product and packaging format could save up to 27,000 tonnes of plastic per year.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a specific company implementing new technology; Environmental and Societal: Environmental impact through plastic waste reduction at societal scale
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental] Unilever's technology reduces plastic waste by thousands of tonnes annually
claude4: Rationale: Clear causal link where Unilever's organizational action (implementing new technology) directly produces measurable environmental outcomes (plastic waste reduction). The text explicitly quantifies the environmental impact resulting from the company's technological implementation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever (and its Dove brand) is the actor adopting the technology.; Environmental and Societal: Plastic reduction is an environmental outcome.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever’s roll-out of the technology is stated to reduce plastic use by up to 27,000 tonnes per year.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links Unilever’s organizational action (full roll-out) to an environmental outcome (plastic saved). “Industry” is mentioned but without a causal effect, and individuals are not explicit actors.
4o: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
4o: Links: Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The industry represents a system of organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Plastic waste reduction impacts societal-level environmental systems.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's technology impacts both the industry and environmental plastic waste reduction.
4o: Rationale: Unilever's innovation affects the industry by setting a new standard and reduces plastic waste, impacting environmental systems. The scales are clear and distinct.
gemini2.5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a single company.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The 'industry' refers to a system of organizations.; Environmental and Societal: The saving of 'plastic' represents an environmental impact.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's technology creates a breakthrough for the industry and directly reduces environmental plastic waste.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes Unilever (Organizational) developing a technology that causally influences the 'industry' (Inter-Organizational / Sector) and leads to a reduction in 'plastic' (Environmental and Societal impact). Three distinct scales were identified, adhering to the protocol's limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever has waived exclusivity rights from 1 January 2015, so that other manufacturers can also use the technology.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's policy decision to waive exclusivity rights, allowing other manufacturers to use technology. While this involves organizational actors (Unilever and other manufacturers), no explicit cross-scale causal interaction is described - only a policy change that enables potential future interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company acting.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: 'Other manufacturers' refers to multiple firms across the sector.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Unilever’s waiver enables other manufacturers to use the technology.
gpt5: Rationale: Unilever (an organization) changes IP access, enabling multiple firms across the sector to use the technology. This is explicit cross-scale causality; no other scales are mentioned.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Other manufacturers represent a sector-level interaction.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Unilever's waiver of exclusivity rights allows other manufacturers to use the technology.
4o: Rationale: Unilever's action directly impacts the sector by enabling other manufacturers to use the technology. Only two scales are involved, making the link clear and direct.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to multiple 'other manufacturers' in the industry, indicating a sector-level impact.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Unilever's action enables technology use across the manufacturing sector.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The action of a single organization (Unilever) directly influences the capabilities of other organizations within the sector. This establishes a clear causal link from the Organizational to the Inter-Organizational / Sector scale.

Full Paragraph Text: Our clear Purpose helps us to remain distinct in the eyes of consumers, retailers and suppliers.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how a Purpose helps maintain distinctness among various stakeholders (consumers, retailers, suppliers) but does not establish explicit causal relationships between different hierarchical scales. It presents a general statement about maintaining distinction rather than describing specific cross-scale interactions or influences.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'Our' and 'Purpose' refer to one company/organization.; Individual: 'Consumers' are individual people.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The company’s clear purpose shapes consumers’ perception of its distinctness.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit wording ties the organization’s purpose to how consumers view it, a cross-scale causal effect. Retailers and suppliers are organizations (same scale as the firm), so no org->org links included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a general statement about purpose and perception but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'Our' refers to an organization or brand.; Individual: 'consumers' are specific people.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] An organization's distinct purpose influences how individual consumers perceive it.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that an Organizational actor's distinctness, derived from its purpose, causally influences the perception of Individual consumers. Mentions of retailers and suppliers represent same-scale interactions (Organizational -> Organizational), which are excluded by the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: It also means we can set an ambitious Vision – to double the size of the business whilst reducing our environmental footprint and increasing our positive social impact.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes an organizational vision with goals but contains no explicit causal interactions between different scales. It states aspirational targets without describing how actors at different scales influence each other.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “We/the business” is one company setting a vision.; Environmental and Societal: “Environmental footprint” and “social impact” are effects on ecosystems and communities.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The company sets a vision to cut its environmental footprint and boost social impact.
gpt5: Rationale: The organization explicitly commits to actions that affect environmental and societal outcomes. No other scales are mentioned with causal ties, so only this cross-scale link is included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes an organizational vision without explicit cross-scale causality. No specific actors at different scales are mentioned influencing each other.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'the business' and the implied 'we' setting the vision.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'environmental footprint' and 'positive social impact'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] An Organizational actor aims to influence the Environmental and Societal scale by reducing its footprint and increasing social impact.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states an Organizational actor's goal to causally influence the Environmental and Societal scale by reducing its environmental footprint and increasing its positive social impact. Only two distinct scales were identified, meeting the scale limitation.

Full Paragraph Text: To meet our growth ambition we invest in people whose talent will help us win through our brands and innovation, unrivalled execution in the market place and a relentless focus on continuous improvement for greater efficiency.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational strategy and investment in people but lacks explicit causal relationships between different scales. While 'people' could be Individual scale and the organization could be Organizational scale, the text only states investment intentions without describing actual cross-scale interactions or influences.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: "people" whose talent is referenced; Organizational: "we/our" referring to the company investing and aiming to win
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Employees’ talent helps the company win; the company invests in people to drive growth.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit two-way causality is stated: the organization invests in people, and their talent helps the organization win. Mentions of brands/marketplace do not state cross-scale effects, so only two scales are used.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal strategies and goals without explicit cross-scale causal interactions. No distinct scales are causally linked.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'we' refers to the company/organization with the growth ambition.; Individual: 'people' refers to specific workers/employees within the organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] The organization invests in individuals, whose talent then contributes to the organization's success.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes the 'we' (Organizational) investing in 'people' (Individual), and then the 'people's' talent helping 'us' (Organizational) win. These are clear cross-scale causal links. Only two scales were identified, well within the limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Our environmental and social ambitions are driven through the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP), which has economic benefits and operates across all our brands, markets and our entire value chain.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as one company with its USLP plan and brands; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Entire value chain spanning multiple organizations
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational] USLP drives sustainability across Unilever's entire value chain
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states USLP operates across the entire value chain, showing clear causality from Unilever's organizational plan to inter-organizational implementation. Only two distinct scales are present.
gpt5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) is an internal program of Unilever.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: “Entire value chain” denotes a multi-firm supply chain system.; Environmental and Societal: “Markets” refers to societal-level market systems.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] The USLP is implemented across the value chain and markets, showing organizational action spanning higher-level systems.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the USLP operates across the value chain (supply chain) and markets, creating cross-scale organizational-to-system interactions. Other mentions (brands, ambitions) are intra-organizational and excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan's influence but does not explicitly show cross-scale causality between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scales: Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Organizational -> Inter-Organizational / Sector
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever and its USLP are a single company and its internal program.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The 'value chain' represents collaborations and systems among organizations.; Environmental and Societal: 'Markets' refer to the broader societal systems where the organization operates.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's Sustainable Living Plan (Organizational) influences its value chain (Inter-Organizational) and the markets (Environmental and Societal) it operates within.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes how Unilever's organizational plan (USLP) causally 'operates across' its inter-organizational value chain and the environmental and societal markets. This demonstrates clear cross-scale influence from the Organizational scale to both Inter-Organizational and Environmental and Societal scales. Three distinct scales were identified and used.

Full Paragraph Text: Even when markets are tough we cannot ignore sustainability. If we did, this would diminish the future resilience of Unilever for its long-term shareholders.
claude4: Rationale: The text presents a conditional statement about what would happen if Unilever ignored sustainability, but does not describe any actual cross-scale causal interaction occurring. It discusses potential consequences rather than explicit actions between different scale actors.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only organizational self-impact is explicit (Unilever’s resilience). “Tough markets” is concessive, not causal, and shareholders are mentioned without a stated effect on them. No cross-scale causality is asserted.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific company.; Environmental and Societal: Long-term shareholders represent societal-level systems.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Shareholders' interests in sustainability influence Unilever's resilience strategies.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph implies that Unilever's actions are influenced by the interests of its long-term shareholders, a societal-level system. This creates a cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company, which is an organization.; Individual: Long-term shareholders are specific people or informal groups.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's organizational resilience directly affects its individual long-term shareholders.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the diminished resilience of Unilever (Organizational) would directly impact its long-term shareholders (Individual), establishing a clear cross-scale causal link. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: We would miss out on the growing consumer preference for goods that do not damage the environment or exploit people.
claude4: Rationale: The text describes a hypothetical consequence ('would miss out') rather than an explicit causal interaction. Consumer preference is mentioned as an abstract trend without identifying specific actors or their causal relationships across scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit cross-scale causality is stated. 'We' is ambiguous, and consumer preference is described without a concrete causal effect on another clearly defined-scale actor.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph mentions consumer preferences but does not describe any explicit cross-scale causal interaction between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'consumer' and 'people' being exploited.; Organizational: Refers to 'We', implying a company or organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Consumer preference influences organizational outcomes.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'consumer preference' (Individual) directly affects whether 'We' (Organizational) would 'miss out'. This establishes a clear causal link from the individual scale to the organizational scale. The 'environment' and 'people' are attributes of the goods preferred, not direct actors in a cross-scale causal interaction in this specific sentence.

Full Paragraph Text: Our entire business would rely on increasingly rare and expensive raw materials, pushing up our costs. Without more efficient use of energy our production costs would increase while we would miss considerable savings from more sustainable packaging and less waste.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes potential business impacts from resource scarcity and inefficiency but lacks explicit cross-scale causal relationships. All described effects (cost increases, missed savings) remain within organizational boundaries without clear actors from different scales interacting.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('our entire business') and its production costs.; Environmental and Societal: Resource scarcity and market prices for raw materials.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Rising scarcity and prices of raw materials increase the company's costs.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit text ties societal resource conditions to organizational costs. Energy efficiency, packaging, and waste refer to internal choices affecting costs, which are same-scale, so excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses potential impacts on a business but does not explicitly describe cross-scale causality between defined scales. It lacks concrete actors at different scales interacting causally.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'Our entire business' and its internal 'costs', 'production costs', 'savings', and operational practices.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'increasingly rare and expensive raw materials', representing resources within ecosystems or capital markets.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Rare and expensive raw materials from the environment and society increase an organization's costs.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'increasingly rare and expensive raw materials' (Environmental and Societal) would lead to 'pushing up our costs' (Organizational). This establishes a clear causal link between these two distinct scales. Other interactions described are internal to the Organizational scale.

Full Paragraph Text: We would also risk the disapproval of governments, regulators and NGOs, and our brands – Unilever’s crown jewels – could suffer reputational damage, representing serious economic loss to the business.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Governments, regulators, and NGOs are societal-level institutions; Organizational: Unilever as a company and its brands are organizational entities
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Societal disapproval causes organizational reputational and economic damage
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly describes how disapproval from societal institutions (governments, regulators, NGOs) would causally result in reputational damage to Unilever's brands and economic loss to the business. This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship from societal to organizational level.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Governments and regulators are societal institutions.; Organizational: Unilever (the business) and its brands are organizational actors.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Government/regulator disapproval is tied to brand reputational damage, leading to losses for the business.
gpt5: Rationale: The text connects societal actors’ disapproval to organizational brand harm, a cross-scale effect. NGOs are organizations but including them would yield same-scale links, so excluded. The loss to the business is intra-organizational and omitted.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever and its brands are specific organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Governments, regulators, and NGOs are societal-level actors.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Governments and NGOs can impact Unilever's reputation, causing economic loss.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how societal actors (governments, regulators, NGOs) can negatively impact an organization (Unilever) by causing reputational damage. This is a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Includes governments, regulators, and NGOs as societal-level bodies.; Organizational: Refers to Unilever's brands and the business itself.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Disapproval from societal actors causes reputational damage to the organization.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly links disapproval from Environmental and Societal actors (governments, regulators, NGOs) to reputational damage suffered by an Organizational actor (Unilever's brands). The subsequent link from reputational damage to economic loss is within the Organizational scale and thus excluded.

Full Paragraph Text: That’s why sustainability is at the heart of everything we do to ensure we have a viable long-term business that is attractive to investors.
claude4: Rationale: The text describes sustainability as a business strategy to attract investors but lacks explicit actors and causal mechanisms. No concrete cross-scale interactions are specified.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: “we” and “our business” denote a single company.; Environmental and Societal: “investors” refers to capital markets/societal-level investors.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The company uses sustainability to make its business attractive to investors.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states the organization’s sustainability focus aims to attract investors, an explicit cross-scale effect. No other scales or actors are specified, so only this link is included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses sustainability as a business strategy but does not explicitly describe a causal interaction between different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the business/company).; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'investors' as a collective group representing capital markets.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The need to attract investors drives the business's sustainability strategy.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the desire to be 'attractive to investors' (Environmental and Societal scale) is the 'why' behind the business's (Organizational scale) decision to place sustainability at its core. This establishes a clear causal influence from the broader financial market on the organizational strategy.

Full Paragraph Text: Tough economic and financial headwinds with continued competitive intensity made 2014 one of the most challenging years that the industry and Unilever have faced for some time. A slowdown in the growth of emerging markets proved a testing environment while consumers in developed markets continued to show caution. Volatile currencies were a further negative.
claude4: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Economic conditions, emerging markets, developed markets, currency volatility, consumer behavior patterns; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The industry as a whole system; Organizational: Unilever as a specific company
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] Economic headwinds challenged both industry and Unilever in 2014
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that economic and financial conditions caused challenges for both the industry (sector level) and Unilever (organizational level). Two separate causal links exist from societal-level economic forces to different scales.
gpt5: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Macroeconomic headwinds and currencies are societal-level conditions.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The industry and competitive intensity describe sector-level dynamics.; Organizational: Unilever is a specific company.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal; Inter-Organizational/Sector; Organizational] Macroeconomic headwinds and sector competition made 2014 challenging for the industry and Unilever.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit causality links macro headwinds to both the industry and Unilever, and sector competitive intensity to Unilever. We limit to three scales and exclude consumer caution since no explicit target is stated.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Individual
4o: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Economic conditions and currency volatility affect multiple actors.; Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization facing challenges.; Individual: Consumers in developed markets are individuals showing caution.
4o: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Economic conditions and currency volatility affected Unilever and consumer behavior.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how economic conditions and currency volatility (Environmental and Societal) impacted Unilever (Organizational) and consumer behavior (Individual). These are explicit cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scales: Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'economic and financial headwinds,' 'slowdown in emerging markets,' and 'volatile currencies.'; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Refers to 'the industry' and 'competitive intensity' among organizations.; Organizational: Refers to the specific company 'Unilever'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] Macroeconomic conditions and sector-level competition created significant challenges for the industry and individual companies like Unilever.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The analysis identified three distinct hierarchical links where Environmental and Societal factors and Inter-Organizational competition causally impacted the Inter-Organizational sector and specific Organizational entities. The 'Individual' scale (consumers) was excluded to adhere to the maximum three-scale limit, as its influence, while present, was less pervasive than the broader macroeconomic and competitive forces.

Full Paragraph Text: However, Unilever’s business model and strategy proved robust, delivering a competitive performance with underlying sales growth ahead of the market and solid margin expansion. Our growth model is based on a leaner, more agile Unilever and consistency of delivery in this more volatile market is key. The Boards remain convinced that a clear, purpose-driven business model is the best way for Unilever to continue generating sustainable, long-term returns for all stakeholders, including our shareholders, as proved by a year of strong, dependable cash flow and steadily increasing dividends. The full year dividend paid in 2014 rose to €1.12, a 7% increase on 2013.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's internal performance metrics, strategy, and financial outcomes without explicitly stating causal relationships between different organizational scales. All described elements operate within the same organizational scale (Unilever as a company).
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The market and its volatility; Organizational: Unilever and its Board; Individual: Shareholders (stakeholders as people)
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Market volatility makes Unilever stress consistency, and Unilever’s higher dividend delivers returns to shareholders.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links market volatility to what is “key” for Unilever’s delivery focus, and states Unilever raised dividends for shareholders. No other cross-scale causal claims (e.g., outperforming the market) are made.
4o: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a company, fitting the Organizational scale.; Individual: Shareholders are specific people, fitting the Individual scale.; Environmental and Societal: Market conditions and societal norms influence business models.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's strategy impacts shareholders and is shaped by market conditions.
4o: Rationale: Unilever's strategy (Organizational) affects shareholder dividends (Individual). Market volatility (Environmental and Societal) influences Unilever's strategy. These are clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever, its business model, strategy, Boards, cash flow, and dividends are all components or actions of a single organization.; Individual: Shareholders are specific people who own parts of the company.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's organizational actions, such as generating returns and increasing dividends, directly benefit individual shareholders.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that Unilever (Organizational) generates 'sustainable, long-term returns for all stakeholders, including our shareholders (Individual)'. This establishes a clear causal link where the actions of the organization directly influence individuals. No other cross-scale interactions are explicitly described in the paragraph.

Full Paragraph Text: Investing in people and in innovation is crucial in this tough environment. To that end, the Boards were pleased to spend time at Unilever’s new state-of-the-art training facility in Singapore, and to see first-hand the high-quality innovations being developed for the Refreshment category at Unilever’s global R&D laboratory in Colworth, UK.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational activities (Boards visiting facilities, innovations being developed) but contains no explicit causal relationships between different scales. The text presents observations and strategic statements without demonstrating cross-scale influence or causation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only organizational actors (Boards, Unilever facilities/lab) are described, with no explicit causal effects across different scales. The statement on investing in people is generic and lacks a concrete actor.
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: The Boards, as specific people, are involved in decision-making.; Organizational: Unilever, as a company, operates the training facility and R&D laboratory.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] The Boards' visit to Unilever's facilities shows cross-scale influence from individuals to the organization.
4o: Rationale: The Boards, as individuals, influence Unilever by evaluating its facilities, showing a clear cross-scale interaction. No other scales are explicitly involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever, its Boards, training facility, and R&D laboratory are all components or aspects of a single organization.; Individual: 'people' refers to specific individuals or informal groups receiving investment/training.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's organizational investments in training facilities aim to develop individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly states 'Investing in people is crucial' and then describes Unilever's training facility. This establishes a causal link where the Organizational scale (Unilever's facility) influences the Individual scale (people receiving training). No other explicit cross-scale causal links were found.

Full Paragraph Text: The volatile currency environment made our review of the Group’s treasury operations particularly pertinent. The Boards also spent time assessing the quality of talent management and Unilever’s competitive environment. Broad exposure to senior managers in 2014 allowed the Directors to gain a deeper understanding of the business and helped in the wider strategy discussions.
claude4: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: volatile currency environment and competitive environment are market-level conditions; Organizational: the Group's treasury operations, Boards, Unilever as company, strategy discussions; Individual: senior managers and Directors as specific people
claude4: Summary: [Environmental/Societal, Organizational, Individual] Currency volatility drives treasury review; managers inform strategy
claude4: Rationale: Two clear cross-scale links: market conditions influencing organizational operations, and individual managers contributing to organizational strategy. The currency-treasury link is most explicit and critical.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The 'volatile currency environment' is a macroeconomic context.; Organizational: The Group’s treasury operations and Boards are organizational-level functions.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal | Organizational] Volatile currency conditions made the Group’s treasury review particularly pertinent.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is the currency environment making the treasury review pertinent. Other statements describe internal assessments or exposure without clear cross-scale effects.
4o: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Individual -> Organizational
4o: Scale Explanations: Individual: Senior managers and Directors are specific people.; Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization.; Environmental and Societal: The competitive environment and currency environment are societal-level systems.
4o: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Currency volatility influenced treasury operations; Directors' insights shaped strategy.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how the currency environment affected treasury operations and how Directors' insights influenced strategy. These are clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The 'volatile currency environment' represents a broader economic system.; Organizational: 'The Boards' and 'Group’s treasury operations' refer to components and activities within a single organization (Unilever).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] A volatile currency environment influenced the pertinence of an organizational review.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the 'volatile currency environment' (Environmental and Societal) directly influenced the 'review of the Group’s treasury operations' (Organizational) by making it pertinent. Other interactions described were either within the Organizational scale or involved assessment rather than direct causal influence from another scale.

Full Paragraph Text: The Boards held in-depth discussions with management on strategy and portfolio development with particular attention to changing market dynamics especially in emerging markets. Despite the short-term challenges, the Boards believe the growth story in these markets remains intact.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes discussions between boards and management (both organizational level) about market conditions, but contains no explicit causal interactions between different scales. Market dynamics are mentioned as context but no specific cross-scale causality is established.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Changing market dynamics in emerging markets are societal/market-level forces.; Organizational: The Boards and management are formal units within an organization.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Changing market dynamics in emerging markets guided the Boards’ strategic discussions with management.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties organizational strategic focus to external market dynamics. No reverse or inter-organizational effects are stated, and no individual-level actors are present.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The Boards and management are part of an organization.; Environmental and Societal: Market dynamics and emerging markets are societal-level systems.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Market dynamics in emerging markets influence organizational strategy discussions.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how market dynamics (societal) influence the Boards' (organizational) strategy discussions. No other scales are explicitly involved.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Boards and management are internal components of an organization.; Environmental and Societal: Emerging markets and changing market dynamics represent societal-level systems.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Changing market dynamics in emerging markets influenced the Boards' strategic discussions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that changing market dynamics (Environmental and Societal) were given 'particular attention' by the Boards (Organizational), indicating a causal influence on their strategic focus. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as the interaction between Boards and management is within the Organizational scale, and the Boards' belief about markets is an internal assessment, not a direct causal link.

Full Paragraph Text: The Boards also reviewed the progress made under the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP). The Directors are confident that the USLP remains hugely relevant in addressing today’s global challenges and will continue to be a long-term driver of profitable growth for Unilever.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal organizational review and assessment activities without explicit cross-scale causal interactions. While it mentions global challenges and growth outcomes, no concrete actors or mechanisms are specified that would demonstrate hierarchical causality between different scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only organizational actions are explicit (board review; USLP driving Unilever’s growth). “Relevant in addressing global challenges” is not a clear causal cross-scale effect.
4o: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever and its Board of Directors are specific organizations.; Environmental and Societal: Global challenges are societal-level issues.
4o: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The USLP's relevance to global challenges influences Unilever's growth strategy.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Unilever's plan addresses societal challenges, impacting its growth. Only two scales are involved, so no limitation on scale detection.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever, its Boards, Directors, and the USLP are all components or initiatives of a single organization.; Environmental and Societal: Global challenges represent broad societal-level issues.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's USLP (Organizational) addresses global challenges (Environmental and Societal).
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that Unilever's USLP, an organizational initiative, is relevant in addressing global challenges, which are societal-level issues. This establishes a clear causal link from the Organizational scale to the Environmental and Societal scale. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to work on succession planning for both the Boards and management, and thorough processes are in place.
claude4: Rationale: The text describes internal organizational processes (succession planning for Boards and management) without any explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales. No cross-scale relationships are mentioned or implied.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: Only organizational-level actors (the organization, its Boards, and management) are mentioned; no cross-scale causal influence between different defined scales is described.

Full Paragraph Text: Our Directors bring complementary and relevant skills to the Boards. In addition to wide global experience, these skills include expertise on finance and accounting, consumer markets, science and technology, customers and marketing as well as government and legal experience.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph only describes static attributes and skills of Directors without any explicit causal interactions between different scales. No cross-scale influence or causality is mentioned.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes the skills of Directors but does not explicitly show cross-scale causality between different scales.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Directors (Individual) contributing skills to the Boards (Organizational). This contribution is interpreted as a causal influence, as the skills directly shape the capabilities and functioning of the Boards. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: I’m delighted that Feike Sijbesma has joined the Boards with effect from 1 November 2014. Feike, who has a wealth of experience as a sustainable business leader and in finance, food and nutrition, has already added considerably to the Boards’ discussions.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph only describes Feike Sijbesma joining boards and his qualifications. No explicit causal interactions between different scales are described - just organizational membership and personal attributes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Feike Sijbesma is a specific person.; Organizational: The Boards are a formal governing body within an organization.
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Feike Sijbesma’s contributions have already influenced the Boards’ discussions.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that Feike’s involvement has added to Board discussions, indicating individual-to-organization influence. No other scales are mentioned with causal effects, so only this link is included.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes an individual's contribution to an organizational board but lacks explicit cross-scale causality. No hierarchical interaction is evident.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Feike Sijbesma is a specific person.; Organizational: The Boards represent a formal internal unit of an organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] An individual joined and influenced an organizational board.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that Feike Sijbesma (Individual) joined the Boards (Organizational) and contributed to their discussions, demonstrating a direct causal influence from an individual to an organizational entity. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: Over 40% of our Non-Executive Directors are now women. This is not surprising for a Group that has long understood the importance of diversity within the workforce and wider value chain. The progress made in employee diversity over recent years has been among the best in our sector and led to widespread external recognition.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational diversity statistics and achievements but contains no explicit causal relationships between different scales. It presents outcomes and recognition without describing how actors at one scale influenced actors at another scale.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The Group/firm is the actor making progress in employee diversity.; Environmental and Societal: ‘Widespread external recognition’ implies broader societal/industry audiences outside the firm.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The firm's diversity progress led to widespread external recognition.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit cross-scale causality is from the organization’s diversity progress to external recognition. Mentions of workforce, value chain, and sector are comparative/contextual, not causal across scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses diversity achievements but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions. No direct influence between defined scales is described.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Individual -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'a Group', the company itself.; Individual: Refers to 'Non-Executive Directors', 'workforce', and 'employee diversity'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'widespread external recognition' from societal bodies/norms.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual, Environmental and Societal] A Group's efforts to improve employee diversity led to external recognition.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes how an Organizational entity's actions influence its Individual workforce, which in turn leads to recognition at the Environmental and Societal level. The Inter-Organizational/Sector scale was present but only as context, not in a causal interaction, thus excluded to adhere to the 3-scale limit.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever’s strategic commitment to emerging markets continued in 2014 with significant investments in brand launches, new production facilities and our operations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's internal strategic activities (investments, brand launches, facility construction) but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions. All mentioned actions are organizational-level activities without clear influence from or to other scales.

gpt5: Summary: N/A

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's actions but does not explicitly link these actions to a different scale such as societal or individual impacts.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions taken by a single organizational actor (Unilever) regarding its internal strategy and investments. No other distinct scale actor is explicitly mentioned as causally influencing or being influenced by Unilever. 'Emerging markets' is a target context, not an active causal agent.

Full Paragraph Text: We undertook major launches of brands including Lifebuoy into China and Omo into Saudi Arabia and the Gulf region. Brazil saw the entry of the Baby Dove range and Omo stain removers.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes brand launches across different geographic markets but lacks explicit causal relationships between different hierarchical scales. It only states what happened (launches) without describing how actors at different scales influenced each other.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The firm ('We') and its brands (Lifebuoy, Omo, Baby Dove) act as organizational actors launching products.; Environmental and Societal: Countries/regions (China, Saudi Arabia, Gulf region, Brazil) represent societal-level markets.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The firm’s launches caused brand entry into country/region markets.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links an organization's launch actions to product entry in country-level markets, indicating cross-scale causality. No individuals or inter-organizational systems are mentioned, so only these two scales apply.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes brand launches in various regions but does not explicitly state any cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to 'We' (the company) and its 'brands' (Lifebuoy, Omo, Baby Dove range).; Environmental and Societal: Refers to national/regional markets like 'China', 'Saudi Arabia', 'Gulf region', and 'Brazil'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] An organizational entity launched its brands into various national and regional markets.

This establishes a clear causal link from the Organizational scale to the Environmental and Societal scale. Only two distinct scales were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: In China we undertook large capital expenditure, building a new dry savoury plant and a new washing powder factory. In Indonesia, large-scale capital investment was made in Siliwangi, creating a plant for Cikarang Foods, adding significant capacity to dry and wet savoury production. In the Philippines a new dry savoury factory was built. Detergent and ice cream factories were built in Africa.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes capital investments and factory construction activities but lacks explicit actors and causal relationships between different scales. All described activities appear to be organizational-level operations without clear cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: All actions are by organizations building plants and expanding capacity; countries/regions are only locations, not acting. No explicit cross-scale causality is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes capital investments and factory constructions but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between defined scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes an Organizational actor (implied company 'we') undertaking capital expenditure and building factories. While 'Cikarang Foods' is another Organizational actor, the interaction of building a plant for them remains within the Organizational scale. No explicit causal links between different scales are present.

Full Paragraph Text: We are extending our distribution reach in the outer islands of Indonesia, rural India and the north and central west of Brazil, while Singapore continues to be a major hub for our development of Unilever people at our Four Acres training campus.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's organizational activities (distribution expansion and training) across different geographic locations, but contains no explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales. All described actions remain at the organizational level without cross-scale influence.
gpt5: Links: Organizational -> Environmental and Societal | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual

gpt5: Rationale: The text links Unilever’s actions to societal locales (distribution expansion) and shows a societal hub (Singapore) enabling organizational development. It also explicitly states the organization develops individuals. Only three scales were retained.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational actions without explicit cross-scale causality. No interaction between different scales is evident.
